sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 17 Aprili 2020, zaidi ya visa milioni 2.24 vimeripotiwa katika mataifa na himaya 210, na kusababisha zaidi ya vifo 153,000.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: Zaidi ya watu 568,000 wamepona. Virusi hivi husambazwa hasa kati watu wanaotangamana kwa karibu, mara nyingi kupitia matone madogo yanayotolewa wakati wanakukohoa, kupiga chafya, au kuongea.

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: Ingawa matone haya yanazalishwa unapomua nje, huwa yanaanguka kwenye sakafu au kwenye maeneo  kuliko kuambukizana katika umbali wa mita mirefu.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Pia watu wanaweza kuambukizwa kwa kugusa eneo lililoambukizwa na kisha kugusa macho, pua, au mdomo wao.

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: Virusi hivyo vinaweza kuishi kwenye maeneo hadi saa 72.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
targetString: Inaambukizwa zaidi katika kipindi cha siku tatu za kwanza baada ya dalili  kuonekana, ingawa kuenea kwake kunawezekana kabla ya dalili kuonekana na katika hatua za baadaye za ugonjwa.Mbinu ya kawaida ya kuchunguza kubadilishwa kwa muda halisi kwa manukuu ya msururu wa polimerasi (rRT-PCR) kutoka kwa chembe zinazotolewa puani.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
targetString: Watu wanaoshuku kuwa na virusi na walezi wao wanapendekezwa kumtumia barakoa.

sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: Mapendekezo ya umma kwa jumla kuvaa barakoa yanatofautiana, huku baadhi ya mamlaka zikipendekeza kutotumika kwao, baadhi zikipendekeza zitumike na zingine zikitaka watu wazitumie.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Kwa sasa, hakuna chanjo au tiba maalum ya kukinga virusi vya COVID-19.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: Maambukizo ya ndani ya ugonjwa huo umeripotiwa katika nchi nyingi kwa maeneo yote sita ya WHO.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Walioambukizwa na virusi hivyo wanaweza kosa kuhusi dalili au kuonyesha dalili kama za mafua kama vile homa, uchovu, na matatizo ya kupumua.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: Dalili za dharura zinajumuisha matatizo ya kupumua, maumivu au shinikizo inayoendelea kwenye kifua, kuchanganyikiwa, matatizo ya kutembea, na uso au mdomo wa rangi ya samawati; inashauriwa kutafuta matibabu ikiwa dalili hizi zipo.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: Zisizo kawaida; dalili katika sehemu ya juu ya kupumua kama vile kupiga chafya, kamasi puani au maumivu ya koo yanaweza kuonekana.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: Dalili kwenye tumbo kama vile kichefuchefu, kutapika, kuhara zimeonekana katika asilimia tofauti.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: Visa vingine nchini Uchina vilionyesha mkazo kifuani na mapapatiko wa moyo pekee.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: Katika visa vingine, ugonjwa unaweza kuendelea kuwa nimonia, viungo anuwai kutofanya kazi na kifo.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: Hii inajulikana kama kipindi cha kupevuka.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: Kipindi cha kupevuka cha COVID-19 kwa kawaida ni siku tano hadi sita lakini kinaweza kuanzia ya pili au kumi na nne.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: Asilimia 97.5 ya watu ambao wanaonyesha dalili wataonyesha ndani ya siku 11.5 baada ya kuambukizwa. Ripiti zinaonyesha kuwa sio wote walioambukizwa wataonyesha dalili.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: Jukumu la waenezaji hawa wasioonyesha dalili katika maambukizo bado halijulikani kabisa, hata hivyo, ushahidi wa awali unaonyesha kuwa wanaweza kuchangia kwa usambazaji wa ugonjwa.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: Uwiano wa watu walioambukizwa amabao hawaonyeshi dalili haujulikani kwa sasa na unafanyiwa utafiti, na Vituo vya Korea vya Udhibiti na Uzuizi wa Ugonjwa (KCDC) vikiripoti kwa asilimia 20 ya watu wote waliothibitishwa waliendelea kukosa kuonyesha dalili wakiwa hospitalini.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: Tume ya Kitaifa ya Afya ya Uchina ilianza kujumuisha watu wasioonyesha dalili katika visa vyao vya kila siku tarehe 1 Aprili; watu 166 walioambukizwa siku hiyo, watu 130 (asilimia 78) hawakuonyesha dalili wakati wa kupimwa.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: Kohozi na mate yanaweza kuwa na viwango vikubwa vya virusi,

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: Kuzungumza kwa sauti kunatema matone mengi kuliko kuzungumza kawaida.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: Utafiti huko Singapoo ulionyesha kuwa kukohoa bila kujifunika kunaweza kusababisha matone kwenda hadi mita 4.5 (futi 15).

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: Ingawa kwa kawaida virusi hivyo haviwezi kusambazwa hewani, Chuo cha Kitaifa cha Sayansi kimependekeza kuwa inawezekena kuambukiza kupitia chembechembe za hewa na vikusanya hewa vilivyo katika njia nje ya vyumba vya watu vilikuwa na sampuli chanya za virusi vya RNA.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Baadhi ya taratibu za kimatibabu kama vile kuingiza tubu na kufufua moyo na mapafu (CPR) kunaweza kusababisha majimaji ya pumu kugeuzwa kuwa hewa na hivyo kusababisha maenezi kupitia hewa.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: Ijapokuwa kuna wasiwasi ya kuwa inaweza kuenezwa kupitia kinyesi, hatari hii inaaminika kuwa ya chini. Virusi hivyo vinaweza kuambukizwa sana wakati watu wanaonyesha dalili; ijapokuwa maambukizo yanawezekana kabla ya dalili kuonekana, hatari yake ni ndogo.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Kituo cha Ulaya cha Kuzia na Kudhibiti Ugonjwa (ECDC) kinasema ijapokuwa haijulikani wazi jinsi ugonjwa huo unaenea, mtu mmoja kwa ujumla huambukiza wengine wawili au watatu. Virusi hivyo hukaa juu ya maenea kwa saa hadi siku kadhaa.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: Hasa, virusi hivyo vilipatikana kuwa vinaweza kugunduliwa kwa siku moja kwenye  kadibodi, hadi siku tatu kwenye plastiki (polypropylene) na chuma cha pua (AISI 304), na hadi saa nne kwenye shaba ya asilimia 99.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: Hii, hata hivyo, inatofautinana kulingana na unyevu na joto.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: Sabuni na dawa ya kusafisha pia ni bora ikiwa inatumika vizuri; bidhaa za sabuni hudhoofisha safu ya kinga ya mafuta ya virusi, ikilemaza nguvu yake, na pia kuvitoa kutoa kwa ngozi na maeneo mengine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: Uoevu mwingine, kama vile benzalkonium chloride na chlorhexidine gluconate (kemikali ya upasuaji), hazifanyi kazi vizuri. Katika utafiti huko Hong Kong study, sampuli za mate zilichukuliwa kwa wastani wa siku mbili baada ya kuanza kulazwa hospitalini.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: Miongoni mwa wagonjwa sita, sampuli ya kwanza ilionyesha kiwango cha juu zaidi cha virusi na mgonjwa wa sita alionyesha kiwango cha juu zaidi cha virusi siku ya pili ya kupimwa.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Ugonjwa kali wa matatizo ya kupumua, virusi vya korona (SARS-CoV-2) ni virusi vipya vya korona vya matatizo kali ya kupumua,

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
targetString: Vipengele vyote vya virusi vipya vya SARS-CoV-2 hujitokeza katika virusi vinavyohusiana na korona kwa asili.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Nje ya mwili wa mwanadamu, virusi hivyo huuliwa na sabani ya kutumiwa nyumbani, ambayo hupasua kiputo chake cha kinga. SARS-CoV-2 inahusiana sana na SARS-CoV ya asili.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: Mapafu ndiyo viungo vinavyoathirika zaidi na COVID-19 kwa sababu virusi hufikia seli zinazobeba virusi kupitia enzaimu angiotensin-inayogeuza enzaimu 2 (ACE2), ambayo hupatikana kwa wingi kwenye seli za II alveolar za mapafu.

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: Virusi hivyo hutumia glikoprotini maalum ya maeneo inayojulikana kama "spike" (peplomer) ili kuungana na ACE2 na kuingia kwenye seli enyeji.

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: Jeraha kali la moyo ulipatikana katika asilimia 12 ya watu walioambukizwa na kulazwa hospitalini huko Wuhan, Uchina, na linatukia sana katika ugonjwa kali.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
targetString: Viwango vya dalili za ugonjwa wa moyo ni ya juu, kwa sababu ya ugonjwa wa mfumo wa kujibu uchochezi na mfumo wa kinga wakati wa maendeleo ya ugonjwa huo, lakini jeraha kali la ukuta wa moyo unaweza pia unahusiana na vipokezi za ACE2 moyoni.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
targetString: Vipokezi vya ACE2 vinaonekana sana moyoni na vinahusika na utendakazi wa moyo.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: Visa vingi vya mvulio moyoni (asilimia 31) na damu kuanza kuganda kwenye mshipa (asilimia 25) umepatikana kwa wagonjwa wa ICU wenye maambukizo ya COVID-19 na yanaweza kuhusishwa na ubashiri mbaya. Uchunguzi wa maiti ya watu ambao walikufa kwa sababu ya COVID-19 umepata maabadiliko maalum kwa sababu ya ugonjwa huo (DAD), na chembe za limfu-zenye mipenyezo kwenye uvimbe ndani ya mapafu.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
targetString: Ingawa SARS-COV 2 ina ukuaji wa ACE-2 inayoonyesha seli zinazonyoosha nyuso za mwili wako katika mfumo wa kupumua, wagonjwa wenye COVID-19 kali wana dalili za systemic hypainflammation.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Hasa, seli T zinazotoka kwa viini vya GM-CSF zilizonyesha kupatana na matumizi monositi zinazotoa IL-6 ya uvimbe na visababishi ugonjwa kali wa mapafu katika wagonjwa wa COVID-19.

sourceString: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
targetString: Ugonjwa nadra wa ngozi pia umeripotiwa wakati wa uchunguzi wa damu.

sourceString: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
targetString: WHO imechapisha itifaki kadhaa za uchunguzo wa ugonjwa huo.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: Mbinu ya kawaida ya kupima ni katika maabara ya utafiti  ili kuchunguza upatikanaji wa jeni (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
targetString: Uchunguzi huo kwa kawaida hufanywa kwenye sampuli za pumzi zilizopatikana na sampuli ya majaribio ya kliniki ya pua; hata hivyo; sampuli ya kohozi na mate pia inaweza kutumika.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
targetString: Matokeo kwa ujumla hupatikana katika muda saa chache hadi siku mbili.

sourceString: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
targetString: Vipimo vya damu vinaweza kutumika, lakini vinahitaji sampuli mbili za damu zilizochukuwa wiki mbili kando na matokeo hayo yana thamani ndogo ya haraka.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
targetString: Wanasayansi Wachina waliweza kutenga mkazo wa virusi vya korona na mfululizo wa jenitiki ili maabara duniani kote waweze kukuza vipimo vya kutoa nakala anuwai za sampuli maalum ya DNA ili kugundua maambukizi ya virusi hivyo.

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
targetString: Kuanzia Aprili 2020, vipimo vya kingamwili (ambavyo vinaweza kugundua maambukizo amilifu na ikiwa mtu alikuwa ameambukizwa hapo awali) vilikuwa vinaendelea lakini havijatumika sana.

sourceString: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
targetString: Uzoefu wa Wachina wa upimaji umeonyesha usahihi ni asilimia 60 hadi 70 tu.

sourceString: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
targetString: FDA nchini Marekani iliidhinisha jaribio la kwanza la utunzaji tarehe 21 Machi 2020 kwa ajili ya matumizi mwishoni mwa mwezi huo. Miongozo ya utambuzi iliyotolewa na Hospitali ya Zhongnan ya Chuo Kikuu cha Wuham ilipendendekeza mbinu za kugundua maambukizo kulingana na sifa za kliniki na hatari ya magonjwa ya mlipuko.

sourceString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
targetString: Glasi ya laini mbili na vyuma vingi yenye sehemu za pembeni inayotumika kuchunguza kamba za pumu ,

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
targetString: Kuwepo kwa Subpleural kwa wingi, njia mbovu (unene unaohusiana na lobular na mjazo tofauti wa alveolasi), na uunganishaji unaweza kuonekana ugonjwa unavyoendelea.

sourceString: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
targetString: Data chache zinapatikana kuhusu vidonda vidogo na pathofisiolojia ya COVID-19.

sourceString: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
targetString: Matokeo kuu ya kipathojia ya uchunguzi wa maiti ni:

sourceString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
targetString: Uchunguzi wa macho: pleurisy, pericarditis, pafu kujazwa na kioevu badala ya hewa na mkusanyiko wa maji katika tishu na nafasi za hewa za mapafu.

sourceString: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
targetString: Aina nne za ukali wa nimonia ya virusi inaza kuchunguzwa:

sourceString: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
targetString: Nimonia isiyo kali: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation yenye lymphocytic infiltration na muundo wa seli kubwa.

sourceString: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
targetString: Nimonia kali: mabadiliko maalum katika mapafu kwa sababu ya ugonjwa (DAD) yenye kioevu kutoka kwa mapafu.

sourceString: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
targetString: DAD inasabishwa na acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) na hiposemia kali.

sourceString: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
targetString: Nimonia inayopona: utoaji wa kioevu katika mapengo ya ufizi na pulmonary interstitial fibrosis.

sourceString: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
targetString: Damu: matatizo mkubwa ambapo protini ambazo hudhibiti damu kuganda znakuwa amilifu zaidi (DIC);

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: Hatua za kinga za kupunguza uwezekano wa kuambukizwa zinajumuisha kukaa nyumbani, kuepuka maeneo yenye watu wengi, kuosha mikono kwa kutumia sabuni na maji mara kwa mara kwa angalau sekunde 20, kujizoeza kuwa na adabu nzuri ya kukohoa na kuepuka kugusa macho, pua au mdomo na mikono ambayo haijaoshwa.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: CDC inapendekeza kufunika mdomo na pua kwa kutumia tishu unapokohoa au kupiga chafya na inapendekeza kutumia ndani ya kiwiko ikiwa hakuna tishu inayopatikana.

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: Usafi unaofaa wa mikono baada y a kukohoa au kupiga chafya unahimizwa.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: CDC imependekeza kutumia vizuizi vya uso vya kitambaa katika mazingira ya umma, ili kuzuia maambukizo kutoka kwa mtu anayeonyesha dalili. Mikakati ya kujitenga na jamii inakusudia kupunguza utangamano na watu walioambukizwa katika vikundi vikubwa kwa kufunga shule na mahali pa kufanya kazi; kuzuia usafiri na kupiga marufuku mikusaniko mikubwa ya umma.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: Miongozo ya kukaa mbali ya watu pia inajumuisha watu kukaa mbali kwa angalau umbali wa futi 6 (mita 1.8).

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: Hakuna dawa inayojulikana kufanya kazi ya kuzuia COVID-19. Ijapokuwa hakuna chanjo inayotarajiwa hadi 2021 mapema iwezekanavyo, sehemu muhimu ya kudhibiti COVID-19 ni kujaribu kupunguza kiwango cha mlipuko, inayojulikana kama "kupunguza maambukizo"

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: CDC pia inapendekeza kuwa watu waoshe mikono mara kwa mara kwa kutumia sabuni na maji kwa angalau sekunde 20, hasa baada ya kwenda chooni au wakati uchafu unaonekana kwenye mikono, kabla ya kula na baada ya kupenga kamasi, kukohoa au kupiga chafya.

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: Inapendekeza zaidi kutumia kisafsha mikono chenye kileo angalau asilimia 60 cha kuua viini,  lakini ni wakati sabuni na maji haipatikani. Katika maeneo ambayo visafisha mikono vyenye kileo cha kuua viini havipatikani kwa urahisi, WHO hutoa fomyula ya uzalishaji wa ndani.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: Katika miundo hii, shughuli ya kiantimicrobial inatokana na ethanoli au isopropanoli.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: Hidrojeni peroksaidi hutumiwa kusaidia kuondoa vijimbegu vya bakteria ndani ya kileo; sio "kitu kinachotumika kwa zindiko ya mkono"

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: Gliseroli huongezwa kama dutu inayotumika kuweka vitu kuwa na unyevunyevu.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: Watu hudhbitiwa kwa utunzaji, ambayo inaweza kujumuisha  kutumia kioevu kama matibabu, msaada wa oksijeni, na kutibu viungo vingine vilivyoathiriwa.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: CDC inapendekeza kwamba wale wanaoshuku kwamba wana virusi hivi wavae barakoa ya kawaida.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: Kifaa cha nje cha kupeleka pumzi mwilini (ECMO) kimetumika kushughulikia matatizo ya kupumua, lakini faida zake bado zinaangaliwa.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: Usafi wa mwili na kuwa na maisha yenye afya na lishe bora imependekezwa kuboresha kinga.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: Matibabu inaweza kutumiwa kwa wale wanaonyesha dalili isiyo kali mwanzoni mwa maambukizo hayo. WHO na Tume ya Kitaifa ya Afya ya Uchina imechapisha mapendekezo ya kuwatunza watu waliolazwa hopitalini kwa sababu ya COVID-19.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: Madaktari wa hali mahututi na madaktari wa mapafu huko Marekani wamejumuisha mapendekezo ya matibabu kutoka kwa mashirika anuwai kuwa rasilimali ya bila malipo, IBCC.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Hadi Aprili 2020, hakuna matibabu maalum ya COVID-19.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: Kwa dalili, baadhi ya wataalamu walipendekeza dawa ya paracetamol (acetaminophen) badala ya dawa ya ibuprofen kuwa chaguo la kwanza la kutumia.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: Lazima tahadhari izingatiwe ili kupunguza maambukizo ya virusi, hasa katika mazingira ya huduma ya afya wakati wa kufanya taratibu ambazo zinaweza kutoa erosoli, kama vile kuweka neli au kupitisha hewa kwa mgonjwa kwa kutumia mikono.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: Kwa wataalamu wa tiba ya afya wanaotibu watu walio na COVID-19, CDC inapendekeza kumweka mtu katika Chumba cha Kutenga Maambukizi ya Hewani (AIIR) pamoja na kutumia tahafhari za kawaida, tahashari za watu waliogusana na tahadhari za maambukizi ya hewani.CDC inatoa mwongozo wa jinsi ya kutumia Vifaa vya Kujikinga Mwenyewe (PPE) wakati wa janga kubwa.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: Mavazi yanayopendekezwa ni: gauni ya PPE, kipumulio au barakoa, kilinzi cha macho na glavu za matibabu. Inapopatikana, vipumulio (badala ya barakoa) vinapendekezwa.

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: Vipumulio vya N95 vimeidhinishwa kwa mazingira ya viwanda lakini FDA imeidhinisha barakoa kutumiwa chini ya Idhini ya Matumizi ya Dharura (EUA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: Vimeundwa kukinga dhidi ya chembe zinazopeperuka hewani kama vile vumbi lakini ufanisi wake dhidi ya chembe maalum za kibiolojia hauhakikishwi kwa matumizi yasiyobainishwa.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: Wakati barakoa hazipatikani, CDC inapendekeza kutumia vizuizi vya uso, au kama chaguo la mwisho, barakoa zilizotengenezwa nyumbani.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: Matukio mengi ya COVID-19 sio kali sana kuhitaji mitambo ya kuingiza hewa au mibadala, lakini inahitajika kwa asilimia kubwa ya matukio.

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: Aina ya kisaidizi cha kupumua kwa watu wenye matatizo ya kupumua yanayohusiana na COVID-19 inafanyiwa utafiti kwa watu hospitalini, na ushahidi fulani kwamba kuweka neli inaweza kuepukwa na kifaa cha kuingiza hewa kwa kiwango cha juu.

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: Haijulikani ikiwa moja kati ya hizi mbili husababisha faida sawa kwa watu ambao ni wagonjwa sana.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: Baadhi ya madaktari hupendelea kutumia mitambo ya kuingiza hewa inapopatikana kwa sababu mbinu hii hupunguza chembe za uoevu ikilinganishwa na kifaa cha kuingiza hewa kwa kiwango cha juu. Matukio kali ni ya kawaida kwa wazee (wale zaidi ya umri wa miaka 60, na haswa wale zaidi ya umri wa miaka 80).

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: Nchi nyingi zilizoendelea hazina vitanda vya kutosha vya kila mtu, ambayo inapunguza uwezo wa mfumo wa afya kushughulikia matukio ya ghafla ya COVID-19 ambayo ni kali sana kuhitaji kulazwa hospitalini.

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
targetString: Utafiti mmoja nchini Uchina ulipata kuwa asilimia 5 walilazwa katika vitengo vya watu walio katika hali mahututi, asilimia 2.3 walihitaji mashine za kusaidia kupumua na asilimia 1.4 walifariki.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: Nchini Uchina, takriban asilimia 30 ya watu waliolazwa hospitalini kwa sababu ya COVID-19 , hatimaye walilazwa kwenye chumba cha hali mahututi.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: Inakuwa ngumu zaidi kutumia mitambo ya kuingiza hewa kwa kuwa ugonjwa mkali wa matatizo ya kupumua (ARDS) hutokea kwa COVID-19 na inazidi kuwa ngumu kuongeza oksijeni.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: Vyombo vya kupitisha hewa vinavyoweza kudhibiti shinikizo na PEEP ya juu vinahitajika kuongeza utoaji wa oksijeni na bado ikipunguza hatari ya jeraha la mapafu linalohusiana na chombo cha kupitisha hewa

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: PEEP ya juu inaweza kuwa haipatikani kwenye vyombo vya kuingiza hewa vya zamani.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: Utafiti wa matibabu yanayowezekana ulianza Januari 2010, na dawa kadhaa za kuzuia virusi yanafanyiwa majaribio la kliniki.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: Remdesivir inaonekana kuleta matokeo mazuri.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: Ingawa dawa mpya inaweza kufikisha mwaka wa 2021 kukuzwa, dawa kadhaa zinazopimwa tayari zimeidhinishwa kwa matumizi mengine au zinapimwa zaidi.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: Dawa ya kuzuia virusi inaweza kutumiwa na watu wenye ugonjwa kali.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: WHO ilipendekeza watu wa kujitolea kushiriki katika majaribio ya ufanisi na usalama wa matatibabu yanayowezekana. FDA imetoa idhini ya muda ya kusambaza kingamwili kama matibabu ya majaribio katika matukio ambayo maisha ya mtu huyo yametishiwa sana au mara moja.

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: Haijapitia utafiti wa kliniki unaohitajika kuonyesha kuwa ni salama na fanisi kwa ugonjwa huo.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: Mwezi wa Februari 2020, Uchina ilizindua programu ya simu na kushughulikia mlipuko wa ugonjwa huo.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: Watumiaji wanaulizwa kuina jina na nambari yao ya kitambulisho.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: Programu hiyo unaweza kugundua "mtu uliyetangamana naye karibu" kwa kutumua data ya uchunguzi na kwa hivyo kuweza kugundua hatari inayowezekana na kuambukizwa.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: Kila mtumiaji pia anaweza kuangalia hali ya watumiaji wengine watatu.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: Ikiwa hatari inayowezekana imegunduliwa, programu haipendekezi tu kujitenga, lakini pia inawaarifu maafisa wa afya wa ndani. Uchanganuzi mkubwa wa data ya simu, teknolojia ya utambuzi wa uso, ufuatiliaji wa simu ya mkononi na ufahamu wa mashine hutumika kufuatilia watu walioambukizwa na waliotangamana nao huko Korea Kusini, Taiwan na Singapoo.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: Mwezi Machi 2020, serikali ya Israeli iliwezesha mashirika ya usalama kufuatilia data ya simu za mkononi za watu wanaoaminika kuwa na virusi vya korona.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: Hatua hiyo ilichukuliwa kuhakikisha wamejitenga na kuwalinda wale ambao wanaweza kutangamana na raia walioambukizwa.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Pia mwezi wa Machi 2020, Deutsche Telekom ilishiriki data ya jumla ya eneo la simu na shirika la serikali ya shirikisho la Ujerumani, Taasisi ya Robert Koch, ili kufanya utafiti na kuzuia virusi hivyo kuenea.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: Urusi ilieneza teknolojia ya utambuzi wa uso ili kuwagundua wavunja sheria ya karantini.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: Giulio Gallera, Kamishna wa afya wa mkoa wa Italia, alisema kuwa amearifiwa na watoa huduma ya simu ya mkononi kuwa "asilimia 40 ya watu waendelea kutembea-tembea tu".

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: Serikali ya Ujerumani iliendesha tukio la kutengeneza programu za kompyuta na washiriki zaidi ya 42.000.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: Pia, rais wa Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, alitoa mwito wa suluhu za kiubunifu dhidi ya kuenea kwa virusi vya korona.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: Watu wanaweza kupatwa na dhiki karantini, vikwazo vya kusafiri, madhara ya matibabu au hofu ya maambukizo yenyewe.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: BBC ilinukuu Rory O'Connoe akisema, "Kuongezeka kwa kujitenga na watu, upweke, wasiwasi wa kiafya, mafadhaiko na uchumi kudhorora ni mbinu bora ya kudhuru afya ya akili na ustawi wa watu."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: Ugonjwa huo unaweza kuwa na dalili chache au usiwe na dalili yoyote, unaofanana na ugonjwa mwingine wa kawaida wa maradhi ya kupumua kama vile mafua.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: Ugonjwa usio kali kwa kawaida hupona ndani ya wiki mbili, ambapo watu wenye ugonjwa kali au wa hali mahututi wanaweza kuchukua muda wa wiki tatu au sita kupona.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: Wanawake wajawazito wanaweza kuwa katika hatari kubwa ya kuambukizwa na COVID-19 kulingana na data ikilinganishwa na virusi vingine sawia, kama vile SARS na MERS, lakini data ya COVID-19 inakosekana. Kwa watu wengine, COVID-19 inaweza kuathiri mapafu na kusababisha nimonia.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: Kwa watu walioathiriwa sana, COVID-19 inaweza kuongezeka kwa haraka kuwa ugonjwa sugu wa kupumua (ARDS) unaosababisha kushindwa kupumia kabisa, maambukizo ya ogani au ogani anuwai kushindwa kufanya kazi.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: Matatizo yanayohusiana na COVID-19 yanajumuisha ugonjwa wa bakteria, damu kuganda isivyo kawaida, uharibifu wa moyo, figo na ini.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: Damu kuganda isivyo kawaida, hasa ongezeko la muda wa prothrombin, imeelezwa katika asilimia 6 ya wale waliolazwa hospitalini kwa sababu ya COVID-19, ambapo utendakazi usio wa kawaida wa figo unaonekana katika asilimia 4 ya kikundi hiki.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: Takriban asilimia 20-30 ya watu wenye COVID-19 wanaonyesha vimeng'enya vingi vya ini (viwango vya juu vya madhara ya ini)

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: Kulingana na ripoti hiyo, muda wastani kati ya dalili kuonekana na kifo ulikuwa siku kumi, na siku tano kutumika kulazwa hospitalini.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: Hata hivyo, wagonjwa waliohamishwa kwa chumba cha hali mahututi walikuwa na muda wastani wa siku saba kati ya kulazwa hospitalini na kufa.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
targetString: Katika uchunguzi wa hali za mapema, muda wastani wa kuonyesha dalili za mwanzo hadi kifo ulikuwa siku 14, na kiwango kamili cha siku sita hadi 41.

sourceString: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
targetString: Katika uchunguzi uliofanywa na Tume ya Kitaifa ya Afya ya Uchina (NHC), wanaume walikuwa na kiwango cha kifo cha asilimia 2.8 ambapo wanawake walikuwa na kiwango cha kifo cha asilimia 1.7.

sourceString: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
targetString: Vipimo vya histopatholojia vya sampuli za mapafu za baada ya kufa vinaonyesha mabadiliko fulani katika muundo wa mapafu na ugonjwa kali wa kupumua katika mapafu yote.

sourceString: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
targetString: Mabadiliko makubwa kati seli pia yalionekana katika seli za ufizi.

sourceString: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: Picha ya mapafu inafanana na ugonjwa mkali wa matatizo ya kupumua (ARDS).

sourceString: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
targetString: Katika asilimia 11.8 ya vifo vilivyoripotiwa na Tume ya Kitaifa ya Afya ya Uchina, uharibifu wa moyo ulionekana na viwango vilivyoongezeka vya troponini au mshtuko wa moyo.

sourceString: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
targetString: Kulingana na data ya Machi kutoka Marekani, asilimia 89 ya wale waliolazwa hospitalini walikuwa na hali zilizokuwa awali. Upatikanaji wa rasilimali za kimatibabu na hali za kijamii na kiuchumi za mkoa pia zinaweza kuathiri hali ya kuweza kufa.

sourceString: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
targetString: Makadirio ya vifo kutokana na hali hii hutofautiana kwa sababu ya tofauti hizo za mkoa, lakini pia kwa sababu ya matatizo ya mbinu maalum.

sourceString: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
targetString: Hesabu ya chini ya visa visivyo kali inaweza kusababisha kiwango cha vifo kukadiriwa kupita kiasi.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
targetString: Hata hivyo, uhakika wa kwamba vifo ni matokeo ya watu walioambukizwa awali kunaweza kumaanisha kuwa kiwango cha sasa cha vifo kimepuuzwa.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: Wavuta sigara walikuwa na uwezekano zaidi wa kuwa na dalili za COVID-19 na takriban mara 2.4 zaidi za kuhitaji matibabu maalum au kufa wakilinganishwa na watu wasiovuta sigara. Maswali yametolewa kuhusu muda ambao ugonjwa huo utakuwa.

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: Mamlaka ya Hospitali ya Hong Kong ilipata kuwa kiwango kilishuka na kuwa asilimia 20 hadi 30 katika uwezo wa mapafu kwa watu waliopona ugonjwa huo, vipimo vya mapafu vilionyesha uharibifu wa ogani.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: Hii inaweza kusababisha pia matatizo ya kiafya ambayo husalia baada ya ugonjwa mkali kupona.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: Kufikia Machi 2020, haikujulikana ikiwa maambukizi ya hapo awali yalitoa kinga ya kufaa na ya muda mrefu ndani kwa waliopona ugonjwa huu.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: Kinga huonekana kama na uwezekano, kulingana na tabia ya virusi vingine vya korona, lakini kuna ripoti ya matukio ambayo watu wamepona COVID-19 na yameambatana na vipimo chanya vya virusi vya korona katika siku za baadaye.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: Matukio haya yanaaminika kuwa yanazidi kuongezeka kwa maambukizo ya muda mrefu badala ya maamukizo mapya.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: Virusi hivyo vinadhaniwa kuwa vya asili na vinatoka kwa wanyama, kupitia maambukizo ya kuenezwa.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Chanzo chake hakijulikani lakini kufikia Desemba 2019, maambukizo hayo kuenea yalitokana na maambukizo kutoka mtu mmoja hadi mwingine.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: Uchunguzi wa matukio 41 ya kwanza ya COVID-19 yaliyodhibitishwa, uliochapishwa mnamo Januari 2020 katika The Lancet, ulionyesha tarehe ya kwanza ambayo dalili zilianza ni 1 Desemba 2019.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
targetString: Machapisho rasmi kutoka kwa WHO yaliripoti kuwa dalili za kwanza kuonekana ilikuwa mnamo 8 Desemba 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Hatua kadhaa hutumiwa kwa kawaida ili kupima kiwango cha vifo.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: Idadi hizi hutofautiana kulingana na mkoa na muda na huathiriwa na idadi ya vipimo, ubora wa mfumo wa huduma ya afya, chaguo za matibabu, muda tangu mlipuko wa kwanza kutokea na sifa za idadi ya watu kama vile umri, jinsia, na afya kwa ujumla.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Mwishoni mwa 2019, WHO ilikabidhi misimbo ya ugonjwa ya dharura ya ICD-10 ambayo ni U07.1 kwa vifo vilivyotokana na maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2 yaliyothibitishwa kwenye mahabara na U07.2 kwa vifo kutokana na COVID-19 vilivyopimwa kimatibabu au kiepidimiolojia bila maambukizi ya SARS-CoV-2 yaliyothibitishwa kwenye mahabari. Mgao wa vifo kulingana na visa unaakisi idadi ya vifo vikigawanywa na idadi ya visa vilivyopimwa ndani ya kipindi fulani cha wakati.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: Kulingana na takwimu za Chuo Kikuu cha Johns Hopkins, mgao wa vifo kulingana na visa duniani ni asilimia 6.9 (153,822/2,240.191) hadi 17 Aprili 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Idadi hutofautiana kulingana na mkoa. Hatua nyingine zinajumuisha kiwango cha vifo (CFR), ambayo inaonyesha asilimia ya watu waliogunduliwa ambao hufa kwa sababu ya ugonjwa, na kiwango cha kufa kwa maambukizo (IFR), ambayo inaonyesha asilimia ya watu walioambukizwa (waliotambuliwa na wasiotambuliwa) ambao hufa kwa sababu ya ugonjwa.

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Takwimu hizi hazijazuiwa na wakati na hufuata idadi fulani ya watu kuanzia maambukizo hadi suluhu la kisa.

sourceString: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.
targetString: Ijapokuwa sio watu wote walioambukizwa hupata kingamwili, uwepo wa kingamwili unaweza kutoa maelezo ya idadi ya watu ambao wameambukizwa.

sourceString: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.
targetString: Katika kitovu cha mlipuko huko Italia, Castiglione d'Adda, kijiji kidogo cha watu 4600, 80 (asilimia 1.7) tayari wamekufa.

sourceString: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.
targetString: Huko Gangelt, ugonjwa huo ulienezwa katika sherehe za Kanivali, na kuenezwa kwa vijana, na kusababisha vifo visivyo vingi, na sio vifo vyote vya COVID-19 vinaweza kuorodheshwa rasmi kwa namna hiyo.

sourceString: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.
targetString: Zaidi ya hayo, mfumo wa afya wa Ujerumani haujashindwa.

sourceString: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.
targetString: Huko Uholanzi, karibu asilimia 3 wanaweza kuwa na kingamwili, kama ilivyotathminiwa kutoka kwa watu wanaotoa damu.

sourceString: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.
targetString: 69 (asilimia 0.004 ya idadi ya watu) wamethibitishwa kuwa wamekufa kwa sababu ya COVID-19.

sourceString: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
targetString: Athari ya maradhi haya na kiwango chake cha vifo ni tofauti kwa wanaume na wanawake.

sourceString: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.
targetString: Katika utafiti uliofanywa huko Uchina na Italia, kiwango cha vifo viko juu kwa wanaume.

sourceString: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.
targetString: Hatari kubwa ni kwa wanaume wenye umri wa miaka 50 na zaidi, na pengo kati ya wanaume na wanawake likikaribiana katika umri wa miaka 90 tu.

sourceString: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
targetString: Nchini China, kiwango cha vifo kilikuwa asilimia 2.8 kwa wanaume na asilimia 1.7 kwa wanawake.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
targetString: Sababu halisi za utofauti huu wa kijinsia haujulikani, lakini vipengele vya maumbile na tabia vinaweza kuwa ni sababu.

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.
targetString: Tofauti za kingamaradhi zinazohusiana na jinsia, kiwango cha wanawake kuvuta sigara kupunguka na wanaume kuwa na maradhi zaidi ya moja kama vile shinikizo la damu katika umri mdogo kuliko wanawake kunaweza kuwa kulichangia vifo vya juu kwa wanaume.

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.
targetString: Nchini Ulaya, asilimia 57 ya watu walioambukizwa walikuwa wanaume na asilimia 72 ya waliokufa kwa sababu ya COVID-19 walikuwa wanaume.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
targetString: Kuanzia Aprili 2020, serikali ya Marekani haifuatilii data inayohusiana na jinsia ya maambukizo ya COVID-19.

sourceString: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
targetString: Utafiti umeonyesha kuwa ugonjwa wa virusi kama vile Ebola, HIV, homa ya mafua na SARS huathiri wanaume na wanawake tofauti.

sourceString: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
targetString: Asilimia kubwa ya wafanyakazi wa afya, haswa wauguzi, ni wanawake, na wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kuambukizwa virusi hivyo.

sourceString: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
targetString: Shirika la Afya Duniani lilitangaza terehe 11 Februari 2020 kuwa jina rasmi la ugonjwa huo litakuwa "COVID-19".

sourceString: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
targetString: Mkuu wa WHO, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, alielezea kuwa CO inawakilisha korona, VI kwa virusi, D kwa ugonjwa na 19 ni mwaka wa kwanza ambao mlipuko uligunduliwa: 31 Desemba 2019.

sourceString: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Jina hili lilichaguliwa ili kuepuka kurejelea eneo mahususi la kijiografia (k.m. China), aina za wanyama au vikundi vya watu, kulingana na mapendekezo ya kimataifa kuhusu kutoa jina linalolenga kuzuia unyanyapaa. Virusi vinavyosababisha COVID-19 vinaitwa virusi vya korona vya ugonjwa mbaya wa pumu 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The WHO additionally uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.
targetString: WHO vile vile inatumia "virusi vya COVID-19" and "virusi vinavyosababisha COVID-19" katika mawasiliano ya umma.

sourceString: Both the disease and virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".
targetString: Ugonjwa na virusi hujulikana kwa kawaida kama "virusi vya korona".

sourceString: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".
targetString: Wakati wa mlipuko wa kwanza huko Wuhan, Uchina, virusi na ugonjwa huo ulijulikana kwa kawaida kama "virusi vya korona" na "virusi vya korona vya Wuhan".

sourceString: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim names for the virus and disease in accordance with 2015 guidance against using locations in disease and virus names.
targetString: Mnamo Januari 2020, WHO ilipendekeza kuwa ugonjwa mkali wa matatizo ya kupumua wa 2019-nCov na 2019-nCov kama majina ya muda ya virusi na ugonjwa huo kulingana na mwongozo wa 2015 unaopinga kutumia maeneo kama majina ya ugonjwa na virusi,

sourceString: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on 11 February 2020.
targetString: Majina rasmi COVID-19 na SARS-CoV-12 yalitolewa tarehe 11, Februari 2020.

sourceString: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.
targetString: Kwa sababu ya vizuizi vya uwezo katika msururu wa ugavi wa kawaida, baadhi ya watengenezaji wa kidijitali wanachapisha vifaa vya huduma ya afya kama vile visafisha pua na sehemu za uingizaji wa hewa.

sourceString: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.
targetString: Katika mfano mmoja, wakati hospitali ya Italia ilihitaji kwa haraka neli ya uingizaji hewa, na muuzaji hakuweza kuwasilisha kwa muda mwafaka, muuzaji wa ndani alitengeneza na kuchapisha neli 100 zinazohitajika kwa usiku mmoja.

sourceString: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and rapidly spread online.
targetString: Baada ya mkurupuko wa kwanza wa COVID-19, nadharia za uongo, taarifa za uongo na kutokuwepo kwa taarifa kuliibuka kuhusiana na chimbuko, kiwango, kinga, matibabu na nyenzo nyingine za ugonjwa na kuenea haraka mtandaoni.

sourceString: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.
targetString: Wanadamu wanaonekana kuwa na uwezo wa kusambaza virusi kwa wanyama wengine.

sourceString: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
targetString: Utafiti ulishindwa kupata ushahidi wa virusi kujirudufisha kwa nguruwe, bata, na kuku.

sourceString: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
targetString: Hakuna dawa au chanjo iliyothibitishwa kutibu ugonjwa huo.

sourceString: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
targetString: Utafiti wa kimataifa wa chanjo na dawa za COVID-19 unaendelezwa na mashirika ya serikali, vikundi vya wasomi, na watafiti wa tasnia.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Mnamo Machi, Shirika la Afya Duniani lillizindua "Jaribio la UMOJA" ili kutathmini athari za matibabu za dawa nne zilizopo zinazopigana na virusi kukiwa na ahadi kubwa ya ufanisi.

sourceString: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
targetString: Hakuna chanjo inayopatikana, lakini mashirika anuwai yanakuza chanjo mbalimbali.

sourceString: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
targetString: Kazi za awali za SARS-CoV zinatumika kwa sababu SARS-CoV na SARS-CoV-2 vyote vinatumia kipokezi cha ACE2 ili kuingia kwenye seli za binadamu.

sourceString: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
targetString: Kuna mikakati tatu ya chanjo ambayo inachunguzwa.

sourceString: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
targetString: Kwanza, watafiti wanakusudia kuunda chanjo ya virusi vyote.

sourceString: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
targetString: Matumizi ya virusi kama hivi, viwe havifanyi kazi au vimekufa, yanakusudia kuongeza matokeo ya kingamwili ya mwili ya binadamu kwa maambukizo mapya ya COVID-19.

sourceString: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
targetString: Mbinu ya pili, kisehemu cha chanjo, kinakusudia kuunda chanjo ambayo inafanya mfumo wa kinga kuhisi visehemu fulani vya virusi.

sourceString: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
targetString: Katika tukio la SARS-CoV-2, utafiti kama huo unazingatia protini ya S-spike ambayo husaidia virusi kuingiza kipokezi cha kimeng'enya cha ACE2.

sourceString: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
targetString: Mbinu ya tatu ni ya chanjo ya asidi ya kiini cha chembe (chanjo za DNA au RNA, mbinu mpya ya kutengeneza chanjo).

sourceString: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
targetString: Chanjo za majaribio kutokana na mbinu hizi zozote zitalazimika kupimwa kwa ajili ya usalama na ufanisi. Tarehe 16, Machi 2020, jaribio la kwanza la kliniki la chanjo lilianza na watu 4 waliojitolea huko Seattle.

sourceString: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
targetString: Chanjo hiyo ina msimbo wa jenitiki usio na madhara uliyonakiliwa kutoka kwa ugonjwa huo. Uboreshaji unaotegemea kingamwili umependekezwa kama changamoto inayowezekana ya maendeleo ya chanjo ya SARS-COV-2, lakini ina utata.

sourceString: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.
targetString: Kuna majaribio zaidi ya 300 ya kliniki ambayo ni amilifu yanayoendelea kuanzia Aprili 2020.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
targetString: Majaribio saba yalikuwa yanatathmini matibabu yaliyothibitishwa tayari ya ugonjwa wa malaria, ikiwemo tafiti nne za hydroxychloroquine au chloroquine.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Dawa za kuzuia virusi zilizorekebishwa zinajumuisha utafiti mwingi wa Uchina, na majaribio ya awamu ya III katika nchi kadhaa kwa sababu ya ripoti kabla ya mwisho wa Aprili.

sourceString: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
targetString: Ukaguzi changamani wa maendeleo ya kliniki ya chanjo ya na dawa za COVID-19 zinaendelea, kuanzia April 2020. Dawa kadhaa za kuzuia virusi zinatathminiwa kwa ajili ya matibabu ya COVID-19, ikiwemo remdesivir, chloroquine na hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir na lopinavir/ritonavir pamoja na interferon beta.

sourceString: There is tentative evidence for efficacy by remdesivir, as of March 2020.
targetString: Kuna ushahidi wa ufanisi wa remdesivir, kuanzia Machi 2020.

sourceString: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with compassionate-use remdesivir.
targetString: Maendeleo ya kliniki yalionekana kwa wagonjwa waliotibiwa na matumizi ya remdesivir.

sourceString: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy.Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020, with preliminary results.
targetString: Majaribio ya awamu ya III ya kliniki yanaendeshwa nchini Marekani, China na Italia. Kloroquini, ambayo awali ilitumika kutibu malaria ilifanyiwa utafiti nchini China mnamo Februari 2020, kwa kutumia matokeo ya awali.

sourceString: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.
targetString: Hata hivyo, kuna wito wa ukaguzi wa wanarika wa utafiti huo.

sourceString: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.
targetString: Mamlaka ya Afya ya Korea na Uchina yalipendekeza matumizi ya chloroquine.

sourceString: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, notes that twice that dose is highly dangerous and could be lethal.
targetString: Hata hivyo, Taasisi ya Virolojia ya Wuhan, ijapokuwa inapendekeza kipimo cha kila siku cha gramu moja, inabaini kuwa kutumia kiwango hicho mara mbili ni hatari sana na inaweza kusababisha kifo.

sourceString: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19.The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
targetString: Tarehe 28, Machi 2020, FDA ilitoa idhini ya matumizi ya dharura ya hydroxychloroquine na chloroquine kwa hiari ya madaktari wanaotibu watu wenye ugonjwa wa COVID-19. Miongozo ya toleo la 7 la Wachina pia inajumuisha matumizi ya interferon, ribavirin au umifonovir ili kuzuia COVID-19.

sourceString: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
targetString: Data za awali zinaonyesha kipimo cha kiwango cha juu cha ribavirin ni muhimu kuzuia SARS-CoV-2 katika chombo cha glasi.

sourceString: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Nitazaxonide imependekezwa kwa utafiti zaidi wa vivo baada ya kuonyesha uzuizi wa kiwango cha chini cha ukolezo wa SARS-CoV-2. Utafiti umeonyesha kwamba ongezeko la maandalizi ya protini kwa kutumia transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) ni muhimu kwa uingiaji wa SARS-CpV-2 kupitia mtagusano na vipokezi vya ACE2.

sourceString: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Utafiti kuhusu dawa ya chloroquine na hydroxychloroquine iwe au isiwe na chembe cha azithromycin una upungufu mkubwa ambao umewazuia wataalamu wa matibabu kukumbatia matibabu haya bila utafiti zaidi kufanywa. Oseltamivir haizuii SARS-CoV-2 katika utungishaji na haina jukumu linalofahamika katika matibabu ya COVID-19.

sourceString: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
targetString: Kuwepo kwa protini ya Cytokine kwa wingi kunaweza kusababisha hali changamano katika viwango vya baadaye vya hali mbaya ya COVID-19.

sourceString: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
targetString: Kuna ushahidi kwamba dawa ya hydroxychloroquine inaweza kuwa na sifa za kupambana na ongezeko kupita kiasi la sitokini. Tocilizumab imejumuishwa kwenye maelekezo ya matibabu ya Tume ya Afya ya kitaifa ya China baada ya utafiti mdogo kukamilishwa.

sourceString: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
targetString: Inapitia awamu ya 2 ya vipimo visivyo na utaratibu maalum katika kiwango cha kitaifa nchini Italia baada ya kuonyesha matokeo chanya kwa watu walio na ugonjwa kali.

sourceString: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
targetString: Ikichanganywa na kipimo cha damu cha seramu ya feritini ili kutambua ongezeko kupita kiasi la sitokini, imekusudiwa kukabiliana na matokeo kama hayo, ambayo yanachukuliwa kuwa sababu ya vifo kati ya watu walioambukizwa.

sourceString: The interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on retrospective case studies for treatment of steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by a different cause, CAR T cell therapy, in 2017.
targetString: Kipinzani cha vipokezi vya interleukin-6 kiliidhinishwa na FDA kwa sababu ya utafiti wa baadaye wa matibabu ya ugonjwa wa ongezeko kupita kiasi la sitokini uliosababishwa na sababu tofauti, matibabu ya seli ya CAR, mwaka wa 2017.

sourceString: To date, there is no randomised, controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an efficacious treatment for CRS.
targetString: Hadi sasa, hakuna ushahidi wenye utaratibu maalum, uliodhibitiwa wa kuwa tocimizumab ni matatibabu bora ya CRS.

sourceString: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunisation.
targetString: Kuhamisha kingamwili zilizochapishwa na zilizokolea zilizozalishwa na mifumo ya kinga ya mwili ya watu waliopona kutokana na COVID-19 kwa watu wanaozihitaji kunachunguzwa kama njia isiyo amilifu ya kinga ya mwili isiyo ya chanjo.

sourceString: This strategy was tried for SARS with inconclusive results.
targetString: Mbinu hii ilijaribiwa kwa SARS na matokeo yasio kamili.

sourceString: Viral neutralisation is the anticipated mechanism of action by which passive antibody therapy can mediate defence against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Usawazishaji wa virusi ndiyo njia inayotarajiwa ya hatua ambayo tiba isiyoamilifu ya kingamwili inaweza kuleta kinga dhidi ya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis, may be possible.
targetString: Hata hivyo, mbinu nyingine, kama vile sitotoksiki ya seli na/au phagocytosis zinazotegema kingamwili, zinawezekana.

sourceString: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies, are in development.
targetString: Njia nyingine za matibabu yasiyo amilifu ya kinga mwili, kwa mfano, kutumia kingamwili zilizotengenezwa za kloni za namna moja zinaundwa.

sourceString: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus, could be increased for quicker deployment.
targetString: Uzalishaji wa chanjo ya dawa ya ahueni, yenye sehemu ya kioevu cha damu kutoka kwa wagonjwa waliopona na ina kingamwili ambayo ni maalum kwa virusi, inaweza kuongezeka kwa sababu ya kutengenezwa kwa haraka.

sourceString: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes
targetString: Ugonjwa wa virusi vya korona, kundi la magonjwa yanayo husiana kwa karibu

sourceString: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan, who later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.
targetString: Li Wenliang, daktrari katika Hospitali Kuu ya Wuhan, ambaye baadaye aliambukizwa na kuaga dunia kwa sababu ya COVID-19 baada ya kuelimisha umma kuhusu kuenea kwa virusi.
